alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 1:07AM CDT until May 08 at 2:16AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Cherokee and Crawford. Portions of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Barton, Cedar, Dade, Jasper, Lawrence, McDonald and Newton. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Many low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 105 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation continues to report numerous road closures across the area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Sons Creek at County Road 113, Center Creek at Azalea Drive, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road and Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Joplin, Pittsburg, Carthage, Neosho, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon and Lamar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
